GT.content: Icarus racing toward sun [via Baudelaire], sinking (sombre) not toward the bottom (fond) but toward abyss; unable to give his name, how could he ever claim he knows how to give? has no sepulture thus no proper name > the whole story? all of history?
GT.linkedContent: Icarus racing toward sun [via Baudelaire], sinking (sombre) not toward the bottom (fond) but toward abyss; unable to give his name, how could he ever claim he knows how to give? has no sepulture thus no proper name > the whole story? all of history?

H.content: law (is always) laid down, laid down against some nature, an instituted thesis > laws that command, impassive, oversees behind glass, tomb of glass
H.linkedContent: law (is always) laid down, laid down against some nature, an instituted thesis > laws that command, impassive, oversees behind glass, tomb of glass

LOBL.content: “the initial [re: J.] keeps (garde) the secret like a grave—jealously”
LOBL.linkedContent: “the initial [re: J.] keeps (garde) the secret like a grave—jealously”

LOBL.content: desire in a glass coffin [see SPOM p. 142 revolution shatters death masks in glass caskets]
LOBL.linkedContent: desire in a glass coffin [see SPOM p. 142 revolution shatters death masks in glass caskets]

AF.content: entire economy of archival law found in these 2 words: memorial & reminder
AF.linkedContent: entire economy of archival law found in these 2 words: memorial & reminder

MPM.content: when de Man quotes Mallarmé’s “this shallow calumniated stream called death” from “Tomb of Verlaine” (signatory of epitaph always writes on his own tomb), Derrida tells us genealogy of genitives cannot be broken by cenotaph or cremation: the tomb of Verlaine of Mallarmé of Paul de Man
MPM.linkedContent: when de Man quotes Mallarmé’s “this shallow calumniated stream called death” from “Tomb of Verlaine” (signatory of epitaph always writes on his own tomb), Derrida tells us genealogy of genitives cannot be broken by cenotaph or cremation: the tomb of Verlaine of Mallarmé of Paul de Man

POOF.content: ridiculous fantasy/staging of death of friendship: friend signs your signature at your tomb > who never dreams such a scene?
POOF.linkedContent: ridiculous fantasy/staging of death of friendship: friend signs your signature at your tomb > who never dreams such a scene?

A.content: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage
A.linkedContent: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage

EM.content: isn’t security of near trembling today? that is, the co-belonging/co-propriety of the name of man and name of Being, as it inhabits and is inhabited by language of West, such as it is buried in its oikonomia [house, tomb see DIF p. 4n], such as it is forgotten, and such as it is awakened by destruction of ontotheology? [trembling: announcement of deconstruction]
EM.linkedContent: isn’t security of near trembling today? that is, the co-belonging/co-propriety of the name of man and name of Being, as it inhabits and is inhabited by language of West, such as it is buried in its oikonomia [house, tomb see DIF p. 4n], such as it is forgotten, and such as it is awakened by destruction of ontotheology? [trembling: announcement of deconstruction]

PAS.content: Blanchot: looking at them (elles) as if they had risen from their graves (tombeaux), and, I remain in their fascination > c’est la scène d’eau, la noyade et l’éventualité de viens
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: looking at them (elles) as if they had risen from their graves (tombeaux), and, I remain in their fascination > c’est la scène d’eau, la noyade et l’éventualité de viens

PPHS.content: Vorstellung, remembered-interiorized intuition; Erinnerung, interiorized memory, places images in reserve, like water in unconscious pit, like vein at bottom of mine > passage to conceptuality
PPHS.linkedContent: Vorstellung, remembered-interiorized intuition; Erinnerung, interiorized memory, places images in reserve, like water in unconscious pit, like vein at bottom of mine > passage to conceptuality

PPHS.content: possession of pit > gives forth its property, produces light
PPHS.linkedContent: possession of pit > gives forth its property, produces light

PPHS.content: Hegel reassembles the feminine law (singularity, sepulcher, night, the divine) around the pit and the pyramid (feminine law only effective in the underworld not on earth)
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel reassembles the feminine law (singularity, sepulcher, night, the divine) around the pit and the pyramid (feminine law only effective in the underworld not on earth)

PPHS.content: signifying intention (bedeuten) over body (signifier, from Cratylus, sēma/sōma (tomb/body), sign as tomb, prison) > Husserl, Saussure, Hegel
PPHS.linkedContent: signifying intention (bedeuten) over body (signifier, from Cratylus, sēma/sōma (tomb/body), sign as tomb, prison) > Husserl, Saussure, Hegel

PPHS.content: Derrida, through Hegel, describes tomb, family crypt (caveau), oikēsis, as the sign of death that capitalizes (thésaurise) on life by marking that life continues elsewhere, il la tient donc aussi à l’abri de la mort; at the heart of this monument, this sign of death, soul keeps itself alive, needs this works of death > the sign, “the height conserving in its depths the hegemony of the soul,” is the pyramid [later, Derrida will live through this tomb not, like Hegel, by negating it]
PPHS.linkedContent: Derrida, through Hegel, describes tomb, family crypt (caveau), oikēsis, as the sign of death that capitalizes (thésaurise) on life by marking that life continues elsewhere, il la tient donc aussi à l’abri de la mort; at the heart of this monument, this sign of death, soul keeps itself alive, needs this works of death > the sign, “the height conserving in its depths the hegemony of the soul,” is the pyramid [later, Derrida will live through this tomb not, like Hegel, by negating it]

SH.content: no worse loss than death of name (still, a date remains) > mourning, interiorization of other in Erinnerung, the preserving of other in sepulcher/epitaph, is denied us; words incinerated beyond sepulcher can return as ghosts > incinerated beyond of date, words lost w/out sepulcher
SH.linkedContent: no worse loss than death of name (still, a date remains) > mourning, interiorization of other in Erinnerung, the preserving of other in sepulcher/epitaph, is denied us; words incinerated beyond sepulcher can return as ghosts > incinerated beyond of date, words lost w/out sepulcher

F.content: je m’arrête ici, déjà (tombe en arrêt [vault to a stop]), setting on the “edge of the crypt” a voiceless word, a blank stone of a scruple [see p. xlviii], to engage others to it, of a crypt
F.linkedContent: je m’arrête ici, déjà (tombe en arrêt [vault to a stop]), setting on the “edge of the crypt” a voiceless word, a blank stone of a scruple [see p. xlviii], to engage others to it, of a crypt

F.content: anasemia: 1) narrative (superposing of “account (récit)”), story, fable w/in concept 2) angle 3) sepulcher
F.linkedContent: anasemia: 1) narrative (superposing of “account (récit)”), story, fable w/in concept 2) angle 3) sepulcher

F.content: paelontologist médusé devant l’arête d’un mot-chose, like a tomb burning in the grass, double-edged stare of a 2-faced Medusa (le double tranchant d’un biface)
F.linkedContent: paelontologist médusé devant l’arête d’un mot-chose, like a tomb burning in the grass, double-edged stare of a 2-faced Medusa (le double tranchant d’un biface)

DS.content: in the morgue you’ve been able to read the folding (vous aurez pu lire que la pliure)
DS.linkedContent: in the morgue you’ve been able to read the folding (vous aurez pu lire que la pliure)

DS.content: glassed-in library, open tombs [Nietzsche, Thus Spoke Z…]

P.content: everything will flower at the edge of a deconstructed tomb
P.linkedContent: everything will flower at the edge of a deconstructed tomb

P.content: [Kant on stone utensils found in ancient tombs]
P.linkedContent: [Kant on stone utensils found in ancient tombs]

SP.content: does one assume one’s own signature? formulation of such question disqualified by structure of the signature: (la signature/tombe)
SP.linkedContent: does one assume one’s own signature? formulation of such question disqualified by structure of the signature: (la signature/tombe)

DIF.content: the capital “a” of differance, a pyramid [A]; Hegel: body of sign is Egyptian pyramid > Derrida moves from pyramid to tomb, oikēsis > tomb of proper, familial residence, economy of death (this stone announces death of tyrant [cf. TN.]) [this tomb can’t even be made to resonate]
DIF.linkedContent: the capital “a” of differance, a pyramid [A]; Hegel: body of sign is Egyptian pyramid > Derrida moves from pyramid to tomb, oikēsis > tomb of proper, familial residence, economy of death (this stone announces death of tyrant [cf. TN.]) [this tomb can’t even be made to resonate]

DIF.content: trace: à la fois, monument & mirage, traced & erased, living & dead, living in its simulation of life’s preserved inscription: a pyramid, to be deciphered otherwise, text w/out voice
DIF.linkedContent: trace: à la fois, monument & mirage, traced & erased, living & dead, living in its simulation of life’s preserved inscription: a pyramid, to be deciphered otherwise, text w/out voice

O.content: preface as excrement of philosophical essentiality? that which falls away (la tombée) > can we account for preface differently?
O.linkedContent: preface as excrement of philosophical essentiality? that which falls away (la tombée) > can we account for preface differently?

O.content: graft w/out body, bias w/out front, skew w/out line
for Hegel, necessity of preface belongs to Bildung, external necessity of concept’s self-presentation, must take time into account as the existence (Dasein) of concept [legibility]
O.linkedContent: for Hegel, necessity of preface belongs to Bildung, external necessity of concept’s self-presentation, must take time into account as the existence (Dasein) of concept [legibility]

REST.content: “to suicide” someone —make him come back (le faire revenir) as a ghost (fantôme) or make him stay (le faire rester) as a ghost, où il est, en somme assez bien enterré, ne disposant plus que de ses pas? > pas de revenant, pas de nom [don’t let the dead bury the dead]
REST.linkedContent: “to suicide” someone —make him come back (le faire revenir) as a ghost (fantôme) or make him stay (le faire rester) as a ghost, où il est, en somme assez bien enterré, ne disposant plus que de ses pas? > pas de revenant, pas de nom [don’t let the dead bury the dead]

D.content: technicity as metaphor that transports life into death, a non-accidental extra, which, in its act of falling (en y tombant): la branche (plugs it in) et la déclenche (and triggers it off): “force vivante”
D.linkedContent: technicity as metaphor that transports life into death, a non-accidental extra, which, in its act of falling (en y tombant): la branche (plugs it in) et la déclenche (and triggers it off): “force vivante”

D.content: opening of presence, “dead surface,” 4th surface, plunged by its “history” into limitless time that is neither “present” nor a “history”
D.linkedContent: opening of presence, “dead surface,” 4th surface, plunged by its “history” into limitless time that is neither “present” nor a “history”

D.content: presence as product, tombe déjà comme un effet, sous le coup (under the sway) d’une structure machinée qui ne se livre (gives itself away) pas au présent
D.linkedContent: presence as product, tombe déjà comme un effet, sous le coup (under the sway) d’une structure machinée qui ne se livre (gives itself away) pas au présent

D.content: moment of present meaning: their “content” only surface effect into which you tombez sans cesse, fascinés by appearance
D.linkedContent: moment of present meaning: their “content” only surface effect into which you tombez sans cesse, fascinés by appearance

+R.content: “the angle is always for me the edge of a tomb (un bord de tombe)”
+R.linkedContent: “the angle is always for me the edge of a tomb (un bord de tombe)”

+R.content: plus d’air, plus r [+R]; each letter, especially gl: re-marks the slippery surface, angled word, edge of tomb, hooked (crochue) signature
+R.linkedContent: plus d’air, plus r [+R]; each letter, especially gl: re-marks the slippery surface, angled word, edge of tomb, hooked (crochue) signature

+R.content: Benjamin theorizes that portrait of face is last “ritual religious art” before “technical reproducibility” > disappearance of the subject as art of the cenotaph [?]
+R.linkedContent: Benjamin theorizes that portrait of face is last “ritual religious art” before “technical reproducibility” > disappearance of the subject as art of the cenotaph [?]

+R.content: inimitable ductus of pickpocket [idiom], repeating (transgression must be repeated to begin) > worst, most fatal of villainies: robbery/violation of tombs
+R.linkedContent: inimitable ductus of pickpocket [idiom], repeating (transgression must be repeated to begin) > worst, most fatal of villainies: robbery/violation of tombs

+R.content: contingent can do w/out discourse, a masterpiece can’t do w/out a cartouche (on the market & in itself: if you insist on this distinction) > even when the cartouche remains, is defunct: pas de cartouche, plus de cartouche > what will have been able to do w/out it? never touched, aussi impassible et invulnérable qu’aux harcèlements du trait: c’est peut-être qu’il était déjà dans la tombe, le cartouche
+R.linkedContent: contingent can do w/out discourse, a masterpiece can’t do w/out a cartouche (on the market & in itself: if you insist on this distinction) > even when the cartouche remains, is defunct: pas de cartouche, plus de cartouche > what will have been able to do w/out it? never touched, aussi impassible et invulnérable qu’aux harcèlements du trait: c’est peut-être qu’il était déjà dans la tombe, le cartouche

TN.content: Nancy stopped short one day (était un jour tombé en arrêt) before Freud’s “psyche is extended, knows nothing about it” > this is a beginning by freezing (par s’immobiliser)
TN.linkedContent: Nancy stopped short one day (était un jour tombé en arrêt) before Freud’s “psyche is extended, knows nothing about it” > this is a beginning by freezing (par s’immobiliser)

CIN.content: entrust words to a page: better to inflame you, eat yourself up immediately, not a tomb that offers patience of mourning, but a tomb of a tomb, deprived of patience of mourning
CIN.linkedContent: entrust words to a page: better to inflame you, eat yourself up immediately, not a tomb that offers patience of mourning, but a tomb of a tomb, deprived of patience of mourning

CIN.content: cinder & smoke (fumée): smoke gets lost w/out perceptible remainder, spirited away, sublimates; cinder falls (tombe), lets go, heavy, more material because it fritters away its word: it is very divisible
CIN.linkedContent: cinder & smoke (fumée): smoke gets lost w/out perceptible remainder, spirited away, sublimates; cinder falls (tombe), lets go, heavy, more material because it fritters away its word: it is very divisible

OG.content: speech (voix): produces signifier that doesn’t fall (tomber) into the world/space [subject can idealize him or herself by suppressing differance as such, myth of consciousness]
OG.linkedContent: speech (voix): produces signifier that doesn’t fall (tomber) into the world/space [subject can idealize him or herself by suppressing differance as such, myth of consciousness]

OG.content: for Rousseau, the wand (la baguette) that traces w/ so much pleasure does not fall outside the body (ne tombe pas hors du corps)
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, the wand (la baguette) that traces w/ so much pleasure does not fall outside the body (ne tombe pas hors du corps)

FV.content: voice guards against the phallus becoming divisible, being reduced to part object, voice as ideal guardianship of partial/divisible object: mors disséminable (ce qui tombe)
FV.linkedContent: voice guards against the phallus becoming divisible, being reduced to part object, voice as ideal guardianship of partial/divisible object: mors disséminable (ce qui tombe)

FV.content: The Purloined Letter, title of the text, not only its object
FV.linkedContent: The Purloined Letter, title of the text, not only its object

FV.content: everyone drops (laisser tomber) [the text] like they do the preface
FV.linkedContent: everyone drops (laisser tomber) [the text] like they do the preface
